category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/028 Chapter Extension 16 Systems Development Project Management

name.text: q001 Which of the following is a characteristic of large-scale systems developme

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of large-scale systems development projects?

name.text: q002 Which of the following statements is TRUE of large-scale systems developmen

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of large-scale systems development projects?

answer.text: They use simple computer programs to ensure consistency and speed in development.
They use development teams of less than 20 members to reduce complexity.
Their development can involve the integration of services from several companies.
Their development is carried out in a single site to ensure consistency.

name.text: q003 The development of large-scale systems can involve the integration of produ

questiontext.text: The development of large-scale systems can involve the integration of products and services from different companies.

name.text: q004 Large-scale systems development requires extended development intervals as

questiontext.text: Large-scale systems development requires extended development intervals as long as five or six years.

name.text: q005 What are the characteristics of information systems (IS) in large-scale sys

questiontext.text: What are the characteristics of information systems (IS) in large-scale systems development projects?

graderinfo.text:
Information systems (IS) in large-scale systems development project have many features and functions. They require substantial computer resources and necessitate the creation of multifaceted, complicated computer programs. They process databases with hundreds of tables; dozens, possibly hundreds, of relationships; and terabytes of data. Such large-scale systems affect many business processes and support hundreds, possibly thousands, of concurrent users.
Because of their size, such systems require a large development team, often composed of 50 to 100 or more business and systems analysts, programmers, PQA engineers, and managers. To add further complexity, large-scale systems are often simultaneously developed at multiple sites. A project might involve teams in the United States, India, China, and other countries. Additionally, the development of large-scale systems can involve integrating products and services from different companies. In these larger development projects, some companies provide licensed software; others provide particular expertise, such as database design; and others provide development labor. Large-scale systems are frequently localized for different languages. Finally, large-scale systems development requires extended development intervals, sometimes as long as five or six years.

name.text: q006 Systems development projects require the balancing of three critical driver

questiontext.text: Systems development projects require the balancing of three critical drivers: requirements, cost, and ________.

name.text: q007 Increasing the cost of a project can reduce the time required to complete t

questiontext.text: Increasing the cost of a project can reduce the time required to complete the project up to a certain point, beyond which, the time required would increase due to ________.

name.text: q008 In the context of a systems development project, which of the following sta

questiontext.text: In the context of a systems development project, which of the following statements is TRUE of the relationships between requirements, cost, and time?

answer.text: Increasing the time for the completion of a project always increases the cost of the project.
Increasing the cost of a project will always reduce the time required to finish the project.
Reducing the requirements in a project rarely affects the time required to finish the project.
Reducing the number of requirements in a project reduces the overall cost of the project.

name.text: q009 Pete, a civil engineer, is appointed to build a state-of-the-art office bui

questiontext.text: Pete, a civil engineer, is appointed to build a state-of-the-art office building. He begins planning the design and construction of the building with his team. He estimates that the building would take six months to build and assigns work and material accordingly to the workers. In this scenario, Pete is specifying the ________.

name.text: q010 The time involved in a project can always be reduced by increasing cost.

questiontext.text: The time involved in a project can always be reduced by increasing cost.

name.text: q011 Larger projects with longer development intervals will find it easier to me

questiontext.text: Larger projects with longer development intervals will find it easier to meet baseline requirements.

name.text: q012 What are the trade-offs in a systems development project's requirements, co

questiontext.text: What are the trade-offs in a systems development project's requirements, cost, and time?

graderinfo.text: Systems development projects require the balancing of three critical drivers: requirements (scope), cost, and time. The requirements against the time and against the cost of a project can be traded off. If the requirements are reduced, a project would take less time to complete and the cost of the project will also decrease. The relationship between time and cost is more complicated. Normally, the time can be reduced by increasing cost, but only to a point, beyond which, the time to finish the project will actually increase due to diseconomies of scale. Thus, at some point, adding more people creates diseconomies of scale. In some projects, costs can be reduced by increasing time. However, this trade-off is not always true. By extending the project interval, one will need to pay labor and overhead for a longer period of time. Adding more time can, in this way, increase the cost of the project.

name.text: q013 Which of the following is a technique that stipulates phases and processes

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a technique that stipulates phases and processes for constructing information systems (IS) but does NOT address the management of large-scale projects?

name.text: q014 In the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide, the different s

questiontext.text: In the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide, the different stages in the life of a project are referred to as ________.

name.text: q015 ________ is the knowledge area that refers to the management of an entire p

questiontext.text: ________ is the knowledge area that refers to the management of an entire project and the construction of the final product.

name.text: q016 ________ is a knowledge area that concerns the methods, media, and schedule

questiontext.text: ________ is a knowledge area that concerns the methods, media, and schedules for exchanging information with the project's sponsors within a team and with others who have an interest in the progress of the project.

name.text: q017 ________ is a knowledge area that concerns contracts with outside vendors f

questiontext.text: ________ is a knowledge area that concerns contracts with outside vendors for services, materials, and outsourcing of functions.

name.text: q018 The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide identifies those pr

questiontext.text: The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide identifies those practices that are known to be effective for different situations and briefly describes their use.

name.text: q019 Knowledge areas of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide

questiontext.text: Knowledge areas of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide refer to the factors in a project that need to be managed throughout the life of the project.

name.text: q020 What is the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide for project

questiontext.text: What is the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide for project management?

graderinfo.text:
Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide, compiled by the Project Management Institute (PMI), contains what many believe are the best project management processes, practices, and techniques. The document does not describe the details of each practice or technique but instead identifies those practices that are known to be effective for different situations and briefly describes their use. Versions of this document are denoted by the year in which they are published. As of 2015, the current version is "A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK®) Guide, Fifth Edition."
PMBOK® Guide is organized according to a grid, which shows five process groups and nine knowledge areas. The process groups refer to different stages in the life of a project. The nine knowledge areas refer to factors to be managed throughout the life of the project.

name.text: q021 Each task in a systems development project should culminate in one or more

questiontext.text: Each task in a systems development project should culminate in one or more ________.

name.text: q022 A(n) ________ is a hierarchy of the tasks required to complete a project.

questiontext.text: A(n) ________ is a hierarchy of the tasks required to complete a project.

name.text: q023 A ________ defines the boundaries of a system in a work breakdown structure

questiontext.text: A ________ defines the boundaries of a system in a work breakdown structure (WBS).

name.text: q024 Which of the following tools shows the tasks, dates, and dependencies in a

questiontext.text: Which of the following tools shows the tasks, dates, and dependencies in a project?

name.text: q025 A(n) ________ is the sequence of activities that determine the earliest dat

questiontext.text: A(n) ________ is the sequence of activities that determine the earliest date by which a project can be completed.

name.text: q026 Prototypes are examples of deliverables in a systems development project.

questiontext.text: Prototypes are examples of deliverables in a systems development project.

name.text: q027 The critical path determines the earliest date by considering the shortest

questiontext.text: The critical path determines the earliest date by considering the shortest path through the network of activities.

name.text: q028 In case of task dependencies in a project, all tasks must begin and end at

questiontext.text: In case of task dependencies in a project, all tasks must begin and end at the same time.

name.text: q029 Baseline work breakdown structures can be used for monitoring a project.

questiontext.text: Baseline work breakdown structures can be used for monitoring a project.

name.text: q030 What is a critical path? How is a critical path analysis done?

questiontext.text: What is a critical path? How is a critical path analysis done?

graderinfo.text:
A critical path is a sequence of activities that determine the earliest date by which a project can be completed. The earliest date is the date determined by considering the longest path through the network of activities. Paying attention to task dependencies, a planner can compress tasks as much as possible. Those tasks that cannot be further compressed lie on the critical path. Microsoft Project and other project-planning applications can readily identify critical path tasks.
Managers can use the critical path to perform critical path analysis. If a task is on the critical path, and if that task runs late, the project will be late. Hence, tasks on the critical path cannot be allowed to run late if the project is to be delivered on time. Additionally, tasks not on the critical path can run late to the point at which they would become part of the critical path. Hence, up to a point, resources can be taken from noncritical path tasks to shorten tasks on the critical path. Using critical path analysis, managers can move resources among tasks so as to compress the schedule.

name.text: q031 Odell is the lead software developer for a new security system that needs t

questiontext.text: Odell is the lead software developer for a new security system that needs to be urgently developed for a client. The client is insistent that the software be as infallible as possible, therefore, Odell would have to plan the systems development with precision. Which of the following activities would be Odell's biggest challenge while planning?

name.text: q032 Scheduling a large-scale project is more difficult than scheduling individu

questiontext.text: Scheduling a large-scale project is more difficult than scheduling individual projects.

name.text: q033 One approach businesses take to address scheduling challenges in large-scal

questiontext.text: One approach businesses take to address scheduling challenges in large-scale systems is avoiding the development of software in-house.

name.text: q034 A function point is a feature or function of a new program.

questiontext.text: A function point is a feature or function of a new program.

name.text: q035 The biggest challenge in planning large-scale systems development is schedu

questiontext.text: The biggest challenge in planning large-scale systems development is scheduling. Describe the three approaches that organizations can take to address this challenge.

graderinfo.text: The first approach that organizations can take to address the challenge of scheduling large-scale systems development projects is to avoid all major schedule risks by never developing software in-house. Instead, they can license software from vendors. However, if no suitable software exists, companies can take one of two remaining approaches. They can admit the impossibility of systems development scheduling and plan accordingly. They can abandon the systems development life cycle and decide to invest a certain level of resources into a project, manage it as best as they can, and take the schedule that produces results. The third approach is to attempt to schedule the development project in spite of all difficulties. Several different estimation techniques can be used. If the project is similar to a past project, the schedule data from that past project can be used for planning. When such similar past projects exist, this technique can produce quality schedule estimates. If there is no such past project, managers can estimate the number of lines of code that will need to be written. Then they can use industry or company averages to estimate the time required. Another technique is to estimate the function points in a program, use each function point to determine the number of lines of code, and use that number to estimate schedules.

name.text: q036 The challenges of managing large-scale systems development projects arise f

questiontext.text: The challenges of managing large-scale systems development projects arise from ________.

name.text: q037 ________ refers to a set of management policies, practices, and tools that

questiontext.text: ________ refers to a set of management policies, practices, and tools that developers use to maintain control over a project's resources.

name.text: q038 A well-managed project will never face problems of diseconomies of scale.

questiontext.text: A well-managed project will never face problems of diseconomies of scale.

name.text: q039 Unexpected events are a minor hurdle and are rarely considered while managi

questiontext.text: Unexpected events are a minor hurdle and are rarely considered while managing a large-scale systems development project.

name.text: q040 The smaller and shorter a project, the greater the chance of disruption due

questiontext.text: The smaller and shorter a project, the greater the chance of disruption due to unanticipated events.

name.text: q041 What are the biggest challenges for managing a large-scale systems developm

questiontext.text: What are the biggest challenges for managing a large-scale systems development project?

graderinfo.text: The challenges of managing large-scale systems development projects arise from four different factors: coordination, diseconomies of scale, configuration control, and unexpected events. Large-scale projects are usually organized into a variety of development groups that work independently. Coordinating the work of these independent groups can be difficult, particularly if they reside in different geographic locations or different countries. An accurate and complete work breakdown structure (WBS) facilitates coordination, but no project ever proceeds exactly in accordance with the WBS. The coordination problem is increased because software is pure-thought stuff. Another problem is diseconomies of scale. Adding more people to a project increases coordination requirements. The number of possible interactions among team members rises exponentially with the number of team members. Ultimately, no matter how well managed a project is, diseconomies of scale will set in. Also, as the project proceeds, controlling the configuration of the work product becomes difficult. Problems can occur with designs, program code, database data, and other system components. Configuration control is vital here. The last major challenge to large-scale project management is unexpected events. The larger and longer a project lasts, the greater the chance of disruption due to an unanticipated event.

name.text: q042 ________ is the process by which users agree to one set of conditions, then

questiontext.text: ________ is the process by which users agree to one set of conditions, then add a bit more, then add a bit more, and so forth.

name.text: q043 Taking responsibility for requirements is the single most important task a

questiontext.text: Taking responsibility for requirements is the single most important task a user can perform for a large-scale development project.

name.text: q044 Requirements creep is the process by which a project manager reduces his or

questiontext.text: Requirements creep is the process by which a project manager reduces his or her responsibilities for requirements through miniscule rollbacks.

name.text: q045 Formalized project management is not necessary for large scale projects.

questiontext.text: Formalized project management is not necessary for large scale projects.

questiontext.text: If a project is running behind, it is best to add overtimes because cost is not a big factor in project management.

questiontext.text: Because it is easy to do, project managers do very well at balancing time, costs, and requirements.

name.text: q057 ________ is good for schedule uncertainties because requirements are manage

name.text: q058 Software is thought-stuff.

questiontext.text: Software is thought-stuff.

name.text: q059 Information systems exist to help organizations achieve their goals and obj

questiontext.text: Information systems exist to help organizations achieve their goals and objectives.

name.text: q060 Describe the user's responsibility in a systems development project.

questiontext.text: Describe the user's responsibility in a systems development project.

graderinfo.text: Taking responsibility for requirements is the single most important task for the users. Users cannot be passive recipients of the IS department's services. Users must make sure the requirements are accurate and complete. Users must also take responsibility for managing change requirements and avoiding expensive scope creep. User must also assist with testing including identifying criteria and testing certain parts of the project.

name.text: q061 Why has the IRS has such difficulty modernizing the information systems for

questiontext.text: Why has the IRS has such difficulty modernizing the information systems for processing tax returns?

answer.text: Congress keeps changing the tax laws making it difficult to stabilize requirements.

questiontext.text: Once you have over 4,500 hours of project management-related experience, you can earn the Project Management Professional (PMP) certification by passing the Project Management Institute's (PMI) examination.

questiontext.text: Why is the systems development life cycle (SDLC) called the waterfall method?

answer.text: It does not return to a development phase that has been completed.
It uses feedback from team members to schedule tasks.
It delivers a working version of the product at frequent intervals.
It can be used only for projects on information systems.

name.text: q004 Which of the following statements indicates why the SDLC is falling out of

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements indicates why the SDLC is falling out of favor?

answer.text: The system design is revised frequently.
It allows the team members to establish the project schedule.
It is risky, as no value is generated until the end of the project.
Systems requirements do not change during a project.

name.text: q005 The nature of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) denies the fact tha

questiontext.text: The nature of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) denies the fact that system requirements are fuzzy and always changing.

name.text: q006 According to the systems development life cycle (SDLC), the progress from r

questiontext.text: According to the systems development life cycle (SDLC), the progress from requirements to implementation is nonlinear.

name.text: q007 The systems development life cycle (SDLC) gained popularity when the U.S. D

questiontext.text: The systems development life cycle (SDLC) gained popularity when the U.S. Department of Commerce stipulated that it would be used for all software development contracts.

name.text: q008 In software development, where requirements change periodically, the waterf

questiontext.text: In software development, where requirements change periodically, the waterfall model works well.

name.text: q009 The waterfall model used by the systems development life cycle (SDLC) is su

questiontext.text: The waterfall model used by the systems development life cycle (SDLC) is suitable for building physical things, such as a runway.

name.text: q010 The systems development life cycle (SDLC) is falling out of favor because i

questiontext.text: The systems development life cycle (SDLC) is falling out of favor because it is very risky to wait until the end of a project to determine the success or failure of a large project.

name.text: q011 Why is the systems development life cycle (SDLC) losing credibility?

questiontext.text: Why is the systems development life cycle (SDLC) losing credibility?

graderinfo.text:
The systems development life cycle (SDLC) process is falling out of favor in the systems development community, primarily for two reasons. First, the nature of the SDLC denies what every experienced developer knows is true: systems requirements are fuzzy and always changing. They change because they need to be corrected, or more is known, or users, once they see a part of the application, change their minds. Other reasons are that business needs change, or technology offers other possibilities. According to the SDLC, however, progress goes in a linear sequence from requirements to design to implementation. Sometimes this is called the waterfall method because the assumption is that once a phase is finished, it is not revisited. Requirements are done. Then design is taken up. Design is completed, and is followed by implementation. However, experience has shown that it just doesn't work that way.
The second reason that the SDLC is falling out of favor is that it is very risky. The people for whom the system is being constructed cannot see what they have until the end. At that point, if something is wrong, all the money and time has already been spent. Furthermore, what if the project runs out of money or time before it is completed? The result is a form of management blackmail in which the developers ask for more money or time. If management declines, which it might because the time or money at that point is sunk, they are left not only with the loss but also with the unmet need that caused them to start the process in the first place.

name.text: q012 The systems development life cycle (SDLC) generates values ________.

questiontext.text: The systems development life cycle (SDLC) generates values ________.

name.text: q013 Designing only the portions of the system that are needed to complete the c

questiontext.text: Designing only the portions of the system that are needed to complete the current work being done is known as ________ design.

name.text: q014 Which of the following is an advantage of using agile techniques over the S

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using agile techniques over the SDLC?

answer.text: In projects using agile techniques, customers test only the completed version of the product.
Changes in systems requirements are incorporated toward the end of the project.
System design is completed at the beginning of the project.
A working version of the product is delivered frequently during the project.

name.text: q015 "Test as you go" is a principle of the SDLC.

questiontext.text: "Test as you go" is a principle of the SDLC.

name.text: q016 Extreme programming is one of the alternatives to the systems development l

questiontext.text: Extreme programming is one of the alternatives to the systems development life cycle (SDLC).

name.text: q017 Agile development methodologies welcome changes in requirements.

questiontext.text: Agile development methodologies welcome changes in requirements.

name.text: q018 The systems development life cycle (SDLC) processes are designed to frequen

questiontext.text: The systems development life cycle (SDLC) processes are designed to frequently deliver a working version of a product.

name.text: q019 Unlike agile techniques, the systems development life cycle (SDLC) delivers

questiontext.text: Unlike agile techniques, the systems development life cycle (SDLC) delivers benefits early and often.

name.text: q020 Agile development methodologies advocate the design of the complete system

questiontext.text: Agile development methodologies advocate the design of the complete system at the beginning.

name.text: q021 Agile development methodologies discourage interaction between developers a

questiontext.text: Agile development methodologies discourage interaction between developers and customers.

name.text: q022 Just-in-time design may lead to substantial revision of the work product pr

questiontext.text: Just-in-time design may lead to substantial revision of the work product produced previously in the project.

name.text: q023 According to agile development methodologies, testing never involves busine

questiontext.text: According to agile development methodologies, testing never involves business customers.

name.text: q024 Agile development techniques assume that the development teams are unaware

questiontext.text: Agile development techniques assume that the development teams are unaware of their weaknesses.

name.text: q025 Agile development methodologies are applicable only to team projects on inf

questiontext.text: Agile development methodologies are applicable only to team projects on information systems.

name.text: q026 What are the principles of agile development methodologies?

questiontext.text: What are the principles of agile development methodologies?

graderinfo.text:
The following are the principles of agile development:
• Expect, even welcome, changes in requirements
• Frequently deliver working version of the product
• Work closely with customer for the duration
• Design as you go
• Test as you go
• Team knows best how it's doing/how to change
• Can be used for applications, information systems, and business process development

name.text: q027 Which of the following development methodologies is associated with the scr

questiontext.text: Which of the following development methodologies is associated with the scrum process?

name.text: q028 According to scrum essentials, the first step of each work period is to ___

questiontext.text: According to scrum essentials, the first step of each work period is to ________.

name.text: q029 Which of the following is TRUE of paired programming?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of paired programming?

answer.text: Two team members get together and write two separate programs.
Two members share the same computer and write a program together.
A team member writes two programs.
A team member and the customer pair up to write a program.

name.text: q030 Diana and her team are working on developing a software to manage accountin

questiontext.text: Diana and her team are working on developing a software to manage accounting processes for a firm. Her team is following the scrum methodology, and Diana is the only person who has the authority to make changes in the requirements and priority of the project. This makes Diana the ________ of the team.

name.text: q031 One function of a scrum master is to ________.

questiontext.text: One function of a scrum master is to ________.

answer.text: stop the misuse of meeting time
change product requirements and their priority
test programs on a regular basis

name.text: q032 Scrum essentials encourage minimal documentation.

questiontext.text: Scrum essentials encourage minimal documentation.

name.text: q033 In the scrum process, a stand-up is a 15-minute team meeting.

questiontext.text: In the scrum process, a stand-up is a 15-minute team meeting.

name.text: q034 In paired programming, two computers are used by the same programmer.

questiontext.text: In paired programming, two computers are used by the same programmer.

name.text: q035 Briefly outline the scrum essentials.

questiontext.text: Briefly outline the scrum essentials.

graderinfo.text:
The following are the scrum essentials:
• Requirements list drives process
• Each work period (1 to 4−8 weeks):
Select requirements to consider
Determine tasks to perform–select requirements to deliver
Team meets daily for 15 min (stand-up)
​- What I did yesterday
​- What I'm going to do today
​- What's blocking me
Test frequently
Paired work possible
Minimal documentation
Deliver (something) that works
Evaluate team's work process at end of period (and say thanks)
• Rinse and repeat until:
Customer says we're done
Out of time
Out of money
• Three principal roles:
Product Owner (business professional)
Scrum Master
Team Members (7 ± 2 people)

name.text: q036 According to the scrum essentials, when is a project said to be done?

questiontext.text: According to the scrum essentials, when is a project said to be done?

graderinfo.text:
Work continues in a repeating cycle of scrum periods until one of three conditions is met:
• The customer is satisfied with the product created and decides to accept the work product, even if some requirements are left unsatisfied.
• The project runs out of time.
• The project runs out of money.

name.text: q037 In a scrum, who is a product owner?

questiontext.text: In a scrum, who is a product owner?

graderinfo.text: The product owner is the business professional who provides the requirements and is available for clarification and testing. The product owner is the only person on a scrum team who has the authority to add, delete, or change requirements and their priority.

name.text: q038 In a scrum, who is a scrum master? What are his or her responsibilities?

questiontext.text: In a scrum, who is a scrum master? What are his or her responsibilities?

graderinfo.text: A scrum master is an expert in scrum processes who helps to keep the process organized and operating. The scrum master is not the boss; he or she is more like a coach or even a referee. The scrum master steps in when meetings go too long, when team members are misusing meeting time, when the product sponsor isn't doing his or her job, and when other situations are not working. The scrum master is also the guardian of team members' time. If distractions occur, the scrum master steps in to eliminate them. If someone other than the product sponsor attempts to change requirements or priorities, the scrum master negates that attempt.

name.text: q039 Who are considered scrum team members?

questiontext.text: Who are considered scrum team members?

graderinfo.text: Team members are the programmers, systems analysts, business analysts, database designers, cloud engineers, PQA testing personnel, and any other staff needed to build the work product. Scrum teams are small; five to nine team members are recommended. If work requires more personnel, then the work is reorganized to be accomplished by multiple scrum teams working in parallel. It's not clear that scrum works well for exceedingly large projects, but then again, it's not clear that any other development process works well for them, either.

name.text: q040 Which of the following statements is TRUE about the points system?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about the points system?

answer.text: Points are assigned by the clients at the beginning of the project.
The most difficult task is assigned a point score of 1.
Consecutive integers are used to award point scores to tasks.
Points estimate the relative difficulty, rather than the relative duration of tasks.

name.text: q041 A team uses its ________ to determine how many requirements it can commit t

questiontext.text: A team uses its ________ to determine how many requirements it can commit to accomplishing in the next scrum period.

name.text: q042 Which of the following statements is TRUE about velocity?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about velocity?

answer.text: The customer sets the velocity of each scrum period.
When a project begins, the senior team members guess the velocity of the team.
After a scrum team commits to requirements in a scrum period, it estimates the velocity it can achieve.
A team approaches the scrum master to change the order of the requirements to which it has committed.

name.text: q043 Which of the following is a characteristic that makes agile development a v

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a characteristic that makes agile development a valid systems development process?

answer.text: Team iteration and feedback are used for scheduling and tasking.
Process scheduling is performed by the scrum master.
Through iteration, team members decide when a project is complete.
Once a phase of development is completed, it is not revisited.

name.text: q044 Scrum is distinguished from other agile development methodologies, in part,

questiontext.text: Scrum is distinguished from other agile development methodologies, in part, by the way that it uses requirements to drive planning and scheduling.

name.text: q045 The SDLC assumes ________.

questiontext.text: The SDLC assumes ________.

answer.text: the government will sponsor all projects
it is better than the SCRUM method

name.text: q046 Software, information systems, and business processes are physical.

questiontext.text: Software, information systems, and business processes are physical.

questiontext.text: All of the following are agile development methodologies EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of the following are principles of agile development EXCEPT ________.

answer.text: deliver working versions of the product

name.text: q049 Teams assess how it's doing at the end of each milestone in agile developme

questiontext.text: Teams assess how it's doing at the end of each milestone in agile development.

name.text: q050 Which of the following is NOT considered a SCRUM essential?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT considered a SCRUM essential?

name.text: q051 Scrum teams can become larger when there is a large amount of tasks to be c

questiontext.text: Scrum teams can become larger when there is a large amount of tasks to be completed.

name.text: q052 The ________ is not the boss but more of a coach or referee.

questiontext.text: The ________ is not the boss but more of a coach or referee.

name.text: q053 Higher ranked requirements are completed last because they take the most ti

questiontext.text: Higher ranked requirements are completed last because they take the most time.

name.text: q054 Overtime the number of requirements that can be completed during a SCRUM cy

questiontext.text: Overtime the number of requirements that can be completed during a SCRUM cycle will get better because of ________.

name.text: q055 What are the characteristics that make the SCRUM method not "hocus-pocus"?

questiontext.text: What are the characteristics that make the SCRUM method not "hocus-pocus"?

graderinfo.text: It is a methodology that incorporates team iteration and feedback for scheduling and tasking. This process allows for something that exceeds what each member can do individually. Also, it provides a framework for process learning. As a team works more scrum periods together, it learns how to assign points more accurately, and it increasingly learns what its true velocity is.

name.text: q056 One reason why the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is losing credibi

questiontext.text: One reason why the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is losing credibility is because the SDLC assumes that requirements don't change.

name.text: q057 Agile development methodologies are generic, meaning they can be applied to

questiontext.text: Agile development methodologies are generic, meaning they can be applied to the creation of applications, information systems, and business processes.

name.text: q058 The Scrum process defines seven key roles.

questiontext.text: The Scrum process defines seven key roles.

name.text: q059 When scheduling tasks using the scrum process points are expressed in value

questiontext.text: When scheduling tasks using the scrum process points are expressed in values from a sequence of integers known as the Fibonacci sequence.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/030 Chapter Extension 18 Business Process Management

name.text: q001 A(n) ________ is a network of activities, actors, roles, repositories, and

questiontext.text: A(n) ________ is a network of activities, actors, roles, repositories, and data and sequence flows that interact to accomplish a business function.

name.text: q002 John's furniture manufacturing company receives an order for 500 chairs fro

questiontext.text: John's furniture manufacturing company receives an order for 500 chairs from the city school. Which of the following is the first step John should take to process the order?

name.text: q003 A customer's credit is checked before checking the availability of goods in

questiontext.text: A customer's credit is checked before checking the availability of goods in order to ________.

answer.text: increase the rate of credit approval of customers
arrange for the special terms requested
prevent the wastage of shipping-verification labor
align the processes with organizational goals

name.text: q004 Acecom Automobiles, an automobile manufacturing company, has always stocked

questiontext.text: Acecom Automobiles, an automobile manufacturing company, has always stocked steel and aluminum for its manufacturing process. However, it has now decided to procure the material directly from the manufacturer, instead of stocking it. This decision will lead to a change in Acecom's ________.

name.text: q005 Which of the following steps is most appropriate if a company decides to as

questiontext.text: Which of the following steps is most appropriate if a company decides to assume additional risk selling to companies with lower credit scores?

answer.text: implementing different ways of checking credit
approving special terms before checking the credit
shipping the inventory directly from the manufacturer to lower the credit

name.text: q006 In which of the following situations will credit checking be made the first

questiontext.text: In which of the following situations will credit checking be made the first step in the procedure of processing an order?

name.text: q007 Repositories are most often collections of data.

questiontext.text: Repositories are most often collections of data.

name.text: q008 While processing a purchase order, if a customer's request for special term

questiontext.text: While processing a purchase order, if a customer's request for special terms is disapproved, the cost of checking availability and credit is wasted.

name.text: q009 A substantial change in the business environment, like the onset of recessi

questiontext.text: A substantial change in the business environment, like the onset of recession, might mean that checking credit becomes unnecessary.

name.text: q010 The credit-check process is independent of the inclusion or exclusion of ne

questiontext.text: The credit-check process is independent of the inclusion or exclusion of new categories of customers.

name.text: q011 Give an example to illustrate how business processes fail to work when misa

questiontext.text: Give an example to illustrate how business processes fail to work when misaligned with an organization's goals.

graderinfo.text: Business processes do not work well when they are misaligned with an organization's goals, objectives, or competitive strategy. The most obvious reason for changing a process is that it has efficiency or effectiveness problems. Consider a sales process. If the organization's goal is to provide high-quality service, then if the process takes too long or if it rejects credit inappropriately, it is ineffective and needs to be changed.

name.text: q012 How can a change in customers, product lines, and supply chains affect busi

questiontext.text: How can a change in customers, product lines, and supply chains affect business processes?

graderinfo.text: A new category of customers could mean that the credit-check process needs to be modified; a certain category of customers is too risky to be extended credit. All sales to customers in this category must be for cash. A change in product lines might require different ways of checking availability. A change in the supply chain might mean that a company no longer stocks some items in inventory, but ships directly from the manufacturer instead.

name.text: q013 A business will be in crisis continually, dealing with one process emergenc

questiontext.text: A business will be in crisis continually, dealing with one process emergency after another, when it ________.

answer.text: plans to develop the business process
actively seeks to change business processes
waits and lets the need for change just happen to it
plans to update its business process

name.text: q014 Which of the following is the first step in a business process management (

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the first step in a business process management (BPM) cycle?

name.text: q015 In which of the following types of business process management (BPM) scopes

questiontext.text: In which of the following types of business process management (BPM) scopes does problem resolution via committee and policy occur?

name.text: q016 Which of the following is an example of an inter-enterprise scope?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an example of an inter-enterprise scope?

name.text: q017 When the assessment process indicates that a significant need for change ha

questiontext.text: When the assessment process indicates that a significant need for change has arisen, the Business Process Management cycle is ________.

name.text: q018 Business process management (BPM) cannot be applied to nonprofit organizati

questiontext.text: Business process management (BPM) cannot be applied to nonprofit organizations.

name.text: q019 Describe business process management (BPM) in brief.

questiontext.text: Describe business process management (BPM) in brief.

graderinfo.text: Business process management (BPM) is a cyclical (recurring) process for systematically creating, assessing, and altering business processes. This cycle begins by creating models of business processes. The business users who have expertise and are involved in a particular process adjust and evaluate those models. Usually, teams build an as-is model that documents the current situation. Depending on the nature of a problem, new process models are then created. The next step is to create process components. Next, the new or changed business processes are implemented. Well-managed organizations don't stop there. Instead, they create policies, procedures, and committees to continually assess business process effectiveness. When a need for change arises, a company models a new, adjusted business process, and the cycle is repeated.

name.text: q020 Which of the following statements is TRUE about the relationship between bu

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about the relationship between business processes and information systems (IS)?

answer.text: A business process and an information system (IS) have the same purpose.
An information system (IS) in an organization is used by only one business process.
Every activity in a business process is a component of an information system (IS).
Information system (IS) elements are embedded within a business process.

name.text: q021 The components and purpose of a business process and an information system

questiontext.text: The components and purpose of a business process and an information system are the same.

name.text: q022 Business processes and information systems overlap.

questiontext.text: Business processes and information systems overlap.

name.text: q023 A procedure is a component of an information system and is embedded within

questiontext.text: A procedure is a component of an information system and is embedded within a process activity.

name.text: q024 A business process need not use just one information system.

questiontext.text: A business process need not use just one information system.

name.text: q025 A particular information system cannot be used by multiple single business

questiontext.text: A particular information system cannot be used by multiple single business processes simultaneously.

name.text: q026 Every activity of a business process involves an information system.

questiontext.text: Every activity of a business process involves an information system.

name.text: q027 The relation between business processes and information systems is many-to-

questiontext.text: The relation between business processes and information systems is many-to-many.

name.text: q028 What are the three principles that relate business processes and informatio

questiontext.text: What are the three principles that relate business processes and information systems?

graderinfo.text: According to the first principle, information system elements are embedded within business processes, but some activities in business processes are not part of any information system. Business processes and information systems overlap, but they are different. Second, a business process can use zero, one, or more information systems. According to the third principle, a particular information system may be used by one or more business processes.

name.text: q029 Which of the following statements is TRUE about choosing whether to develop

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about choosing whether to develop information systems (IS) or business processes first?

answer.text: For a business process that is being constructed, building an information system (IS) after creating the business process is likely to cause problems.
If an information system is built after the creation of business processes, other business processes that use the same information system (IS) can be integrated easily.
If business processes are built after the information system (IS) development process, activities that are not part of the IS may not be considered.
If an information system (IS) is built first, the development team should determine the requirements by itself.

name.text: q030 Creating computer programs and designing databases in-house is more afforda

questiontext.text: Creating computer programs and designing databases in-house is more affordable than buying off-the-shelf software.

name.text: q031 Both information systems and business processes can be purchased off-the-sh

questiontext.text: Both information systems and business processes can be purchased off-the-shelf.

name.text: q032 An advantage of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system is that to imp

questiontext.text: An advantage of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system is that to implement it, an organization need not attempt to do everything at once.

name.text: q033 An application that works for the business processes developed initially is

questiontext.text: An application that works for the business processes developed initially is likely to include functions that will cater to business processes designed in the future.

name.text: q034 Enterprise resource planning (ERP) vendors do not include business processe

questiontext.text: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) vendors do not include business processes as a part of the software package.

name.text: q035 An application that includes business processes as part of the package requ

questiontext.text: An application that includes business processes as part of the package requires time for integration and training.

name.text: q036 Which of the following statements is TRUE about process problems?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about process problems?

answer.text: The task of solving a process problem is ideally given to systems analysts.
An as-is diagram for business processes exists in all organizations.
Business analysts prefer to use process schematics instead of Business Process Modeling Notation.
When a business process has simply evolved, it is possible that no one knows the entire process.

name.text: q037 Which of the following statements is TRUE about designing, creating, and im

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about designing, creating, and implementing a new business process?

answer.text: Process changes that don't work can be undone easily.
Computer simulation of alternative processes is inexpensive.
Technology may change during the development process.
Resolution of implementation problems is easier for enterprise processes.

name.text: q038 The difficulty of creating an as-is process diagram depends on the sophisti

questiontext.text: The difficulty of creating an as-is process diagram depends on the sophistication of the organization.

name.text: q039 If employees are already using an information system (IS), one way of adjus

questiontext.text: If employees are already using an information system (IS), one way of adjusting role resources is to improve the information system so as to facilitate a new process.

name.text: q040 The resolution of implementation problems can be difficult for enterprise a

questiontext.text: The resolution of implementation problems can be difficult for enterprise and inter-enterprise processes because there is no recognized authority to enforce solutions.

questiontext.text: All of the following are examples of roles EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: A substantial change in the market might result in the need to modify business processes.

questiontext.text: The Information systems Audit and Control Association has created a set of standard practices called ________ used in the assessment stage of the BPM cycle.

questiontext.text: List the four stages in the BPM Cycle.

graderinfo.text: Create process components. Implement Processes. Assess Results. Model Processes.

name.text: q049 Business processes and information systems are the same thing, although the

questiontext.text: Business processes and information systems are the same thing, although their purpose maybe different.

name.text: q050 The ________ relationship between business processes and information system

questiontext.text: The ________ relationship between business processes and information systems poses a dilemma when it comes to time build them.

name.text: q051 The ________ relationship between business processes and information system

questiontext.text: The ________ relationship between business processes and information systems poses a dilemma when it comes to time build them.

name.text: q052 Briefly describe why Foundations of Health Informatics are both wonderful and terrible.

questiontext.text: Briefly describe why Foundations of Health Informatics are both wonderful and terrible.

graderinfo.text: When trying to decide if a business process or information system comes first, you can see why Foundations of Health Informatics, which promise to do everything, are both wonderful and terrible. They're wonderful because they include all the business processes and all the system components that an organization will need, at least as determined by the ERP vendor. They're terrible because, to implement ERP, an organization must attempt to do everything at once.

name.text: q053 In theory, it is better to start with business processes.

questiontext.text: In theory, it is better to start with business processes.

name.text: q054 Which of the following is an example of a real-world issue concerning BPM a

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an example of a real-world issue concerning BPM and the "define process problem" activity?

answer.text: Requirements are too difficult to specify.
The best solution is not obvious.
There is a resistance to change.

name.text: q055 Changing technology is a challenge when creating process components in BPM

questiontext.text: Changing technology is a challenge when creating process components in BPM development.

name.text: q056 In designing a new process, two fundamentals actions are possible: keep rol

name.text: q057 Well-managed organizations create policy, procedures, and committees to con

questiontext.text: Well-managed organizations create policy, procedures, and committees to continually assess business process effectiveness.

name.text: q058 All of the following principles relate to business processes and informatio

answer.text: information systems elements are embedded within business processes
a business process can use zero, one, or more information systems
a particular information system may be used by one or more business processes
business processes and information systems do not overlap

name.text: q059 If an organization knows it is going to begin with off-the-shelf software i

questiontext.text: If an organization knows it is going to begin with off-the-shelf software it is better to begin with the information systems first.

name.text: q060 Ideally business analysts are well versed in Porter's models, organizationa

questiontext.text: Ideally business analysts are well versed in Porter's models, organizational strategy, and systems alignment theory like COBIT.
